Description: Fragment of palmette and volute from handle attachment of East Greek pottery oenochoe; fabric thickens towards the top; worn slip; interior reserved; exterior has incised decoration: pendant palmette emerging from double volute; raised central discs on volutes, which are connected by three lines; large quantity of limestone and mica inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Fabric is very similar to that which has been studied with NAA and identified as coming from the region of the Troad.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GL.050)
